meanings.definition: The upper limb of the human body, extending from the shoulder to the hand.
meanings.sent1: She broke her arm while playing soccer.
meanings.sent2: He waved his arm to say hello.
meanings.sent3: The robot arm accidentally knocked over the vase.
meanings.sent4: Her arm of support was always there for her friends.
meanings.sent5: The arm of the chair was carved with intricate designs.

meanings.definition: A weapon or a means of attack or defense.
meanings.sent1: The knight wielded his arm in battle.
meanings.sent3: The arm of the law caught the thief red-handed.
meanings.sent4: His sharp wit was his strongest arm in debates.
meanings.sent5: The arm of justice is blind but fair.

meanings.definition: A branch or division of a family, organization, or company.
meanings.sent1: She works in the marketing arm of the company.
meanings.sent2: The legal arm of the organization handled the contracts.
meanings.sent3: The arm of the family that lives abroad sent gifts for the holidays.
meanings.sent4: The educational arm of the government focused on literacy programs.
meanings.sent5: The medical arm of the hospital provided excellent care.

meanings.definition: To supply or provide with weapons.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers were armed with rifles.
meanings.sent2: She armed herself with knowledge before the exam.
meanings.sent3: He armed his team with the latest technology.
meanings.sent4: The police armed themselves with protective gear.
meanings.sent5: The hero armed the villagers with courage to face the dragon.
